Class RenderUtils

java.lang.Object
com.render.RenderUtils
public class RenderUtils extends Object
Utility methods for rendering and layout generation in Mandelbrot visualizations.

This class provides tools to:

  • Convert between image data and 1D pixel arrays
  • Generate hierarchical layout maps for progressive rendering
  • Render partially or fully completed images based on layout mapping

It supports multi-resolution rendering by layering square regions from large to small, allowing fast previews and gradual refinement of fractal images.

This utility is intended for rendering pipelines that rely on adaptive or tiled Mandelbrot visualization strategies.

  • Method Details

    • imageToPixels

      public static int[] imageToPixels(BufferedImage image)
      Convert an image to a 1D array representing the image.
      Parameters:
      image - Image to be converted a 1D array.
      Returns:
      The pixels of the image as a 1D array.

    • pixelsToImage

      public static BufferedImage pixelsToImage(int[] pixels, int width, int height)
      Convert an 1D array to an image.
      Parameters:
      pixels - Pixels representing an image scanned in an x-first fashion.
      width - The width of the image.
      height - The height of the image.
      Returns:
      The image that the pixel array represents.

    • makeLayoutMap

      public static List<LayoutElement> makeLayoutMap(int width, int height, int maxSquareSize)
      Make a map of the order in which coordinates should be rendered and the size of each pixel on screen. Draw the largest square first and then draw the smaller squares on top of those right down to the single pixels. Once all pixels are in this will create the image as is.
      Parameters:
      width - Width of the image.
      height - Height of the image.
      maxSquareSize - The largest square size during rendering. Must be an integer multiple of 2 so it can be progressively halved until it reaches 1.
      Returns:
      The mapping of all coordinates and square sizes in the order the points should be rendered (the color determined from the fractal algorithm and the image drawn on the drawing panel.)

    • renderImage

      public static BufferedImage renderImage(int[] pixels, int width, int height, int renderTo, List<LayoutElement> map)
      Render an incomplete (or complete) image.
      Parameters:
      pixels - The pixels of he image to be rendered scanned in an x-first manner.
      width - The width of the image.
      height - The height of the image.
      renderTo - The number of pixels in the array to read up +1 (if the value of renderTo is width then the method read up to width - 1.)
      map - The layout map that gives the coordinates and square sizes for the renderer.
      Returns:
      The rendered image.
